block.p: Dr. Marilyn Dabady, a daughter of Therese and Emilio Dabady of Hollis, Queens, is to be married today to Brian Hamilton Lynk, the son of Alexis Lynk and Dr. Rodney H. Lynk of Lorain, Ohio. The Rev. Stephen Gervais of the Federation of Christian Ministries is to officiate at Chateau Briand, a catering business in Carle Place, N.Y.

The bride graduated magna cum laude from the State University at Albany, and the bridegroom graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. They met at Yale, where she received master's and Ph.D. degrees in social psychology and he received a law degree.

Dr. Marilyn Dabady, a daughter of Therese and Emilio Dabady of Hollis, Queens, is to be married today to Brian Hamilton Lynk, the son of Alexis Lynk and Dr. Rodney H. Lynk of Lorain, Ohio. The Rev. Stephen Gervais of the Federation of Christian Ministries is to officiate at Chateau Briand, a catering business in Carle Place, N.Y.

The bride graduated magna cum laude from the State University at Albany, and the bridegroom graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. They met at Yale, where she received master's and Ph.D. degrees in social psychology and he received a law degree.

Dr. Dabady, 28, is keeping her name. She is a senior research associate in behavioral and social sciences at the National Research Council in Washington. Mr. Lynk, 27, is a trial lawyer in the environmental and natural resources division of the Justice Department there.
